intro: Dovyalis somalensis, commonly known as the Somali sour plum, is a small shrub native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically yellow or red when ripe, often used in local cuisines. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. The fruit is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
